title: Witness Patrol
description: Per-rig worker monitor patrol loop with progressive nudging.

title: Demo: Single-command ephemeral deployment flow
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Create demo.sh that does everything in one command:

1. Check prerequisites (node, python, foundry, docker)
2. Deploy smart contracts to Stavanger testnet with default roles
3. Capture deployed contract address
4. Update .env with CONTRACT_ADDRESS
5. Build all services
6. Start docker-compose
7. Wait for health checks
8. Print access URLs and demo credentials

Usage: ./demo.sh
Result: Full running platform ready for demo

Should be idempotent - can re-run services without redeploying contracts (check if CONTRACT_ADDRESS already set)

title: Smart Contracts: BankEUR.sol with all MiCA features
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement Circle FiatToken-pattern ERC-20 with:
- UUPS upgradeable proxy
- Role-based access (ADMIN, MASTER_MINTER, MINTER, BURNER, BLACKLISTER, PAUSER, COMPLIANCE, PROXY_ADMIN)
- Pausable, blacklistable, mintable/burnable
- KYC status storage (hash only, no PII)
- Events: Mint, Burn, Blacklisted, UnBlacklisted, Paused, Unpaused, MinterConfigured, KYCStatusUpdated

Use OpenZeppelin Contracts Upgradeable v5.0+
Include deployment script for Stavanger testnet

title: CI: GitHub Actions workflow for build gating
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Create .github/workflows/build.yml that:
- Triggers on PR to main
- Runs the build script (all components must compile)
- Fails the PR if build fails
- No tests required, just successful compilation

This gates all MRs - nothing merges without passing build.

title: Enhancement: Integrate T-REX token standard for on-chain KYC
description:
Integrate T-REX (ERC-3643) token standard for compliant security tokens:
- On-chain identity management
- Claim-based KYC verification
- Transfer restrictions based on identity claims
- Compliance with regulated securities requirements

Reference: https://tokeny.com/t-rex-token-standard/

title: Fix: Replace bcrypt with bcryptjs (Docker compatibility)
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Node containers crash with 'Exec format error' on bcrypt native module.

Cause: bcrypt binary compiled on macOS (ARM64) doesn't work in Linux Docker containers.

Fix:
1. Replace 'bcrypt' with 'bcryptjs' in auth-service and token-service package.json
2. Update imports: const bcrypt = require('bcryptjs') instead of require('bcrypt')
3. API is identical, no code changes needed beyond import

bcryptjs is pure JavaScript - works everywhere without native compilation.

title: Fix: demo.sh local Anvil mode for zero-config demos
description:
demo.sh fails because nvm is not sourced in non-interactive shells.

Fix:
1. Source ~/.nvm/nvm.sh at script start if it exists
2. Add .nvmrc with node version requirement (20)
3. Run 'nvm use' if nvm is available and node version is outdated
4. Check node version and warn if too old

Keep Stavanger testnet as default - user has testnet ETH.

title: Docs: Operations Guide for deployment and service restarts
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Create OPERATIONS.md with:
1. One-time contract deployment procedure
2. How to restart services with existing deployed contracts
3. Environment variables that need updating after deployment
4. Production checklist
5. Common operational scenarios

title: Backend: Auth & Token Services (Node.js)
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement two Node.js services:

1. auth-service (port 3001):
- OAuth 2.0 / JWT authentication
- 2FA support
- Role-based access control
- Session management

2. token-service (port 3002):
- Blockchain RPC integration (ethers.js or viem)
- Mint/burn endpoints (role-protected)
- Transfer monitoring
- Event indexing

Both services should have:
- TypeScript
- Express or Fastify
- PostgreSQL connection
- Redis for caching/sessions
- Health check endpoints
- OpenAPI/Swagger docs

title: Backend: Compliance & Analytics Services (Python)
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement two Python FastAPI services:

1. compliance-service (port 3003):
- AML alert queue management
- Travel Rule (IVMS101) data handling
- Sanctions screening integration points
- SAR workflow support
- Risk scoring

2. analytics-service (port 3004):
- Transaction volume metrics
- User activity analytics
- Supply tracking
- Report generation (CSV/PDF)

Both services should have:
- Python 3.11+
- FastAPI
- PostgreSQL (asyncpg/SQLAlchemy)
- Redis integration
- Health check endpoints
- OpenAPI docs auto-generated
close_reason: Implemented compliance-service and analytics-service with all required features

title: Enhancement: Dockerize full build process
description:
Build everything inside Docker to avoid host/container architecture mismatches.

Create docker-build.sh or update build.sh to:
1. Use multi-stage Docker builds
2. npm install runs inside Linux container (not on host)
3. Python deps installed in container
4. Frontend builds run in container
5. Output: ready-to-run Docker images

Benefits:
- No host dependency issues (bcrypt, etc.)
- Deterministic builds regardless of host OS
- Works on Mac ARM64, Intel, Linux equally

title: Frontend: Operations Dashboard full implementation
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement operations-app (port 4003) with full UI:
- Supply management (total supply, mint/burn history)
- Minting console with allowance management
- Burning console with redemption processing
- Emergency controls (pause, blacklist)
- Role administration
- Reserve dashboard

Use React 18, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Recharts

title: Frontend: All 5 Dashboard Applications
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement 5 React dashboard applications:

1. retail-app (port 4001) - Consumer dashboard
   - Portfolio overview, send/receive, transaction history, fiat ramp UI

2. institutional-app (port 4002) - Corporate dashboard
   - Multi-wallet management, bulk payments, approval workflows, API management

3. operations-app (port 4003) - Bank operations
   - Supply management, minting/burning console, emergency controls

4. compliance-app (port 4004) - Compliance officer
   - Alert queue, case management, SAR workflow, Travel Rule console

5. auditor-app (port 4005) - External auditor (read-only)
   - Reserve attestation, supply verification, audit trails, Merkle proof verification

All apps should use:
- React 18 + TypeScript
- Tailwind CSS
- Recharts for data visualization
- Shared component library
- Wallet connection (wagmi/viem)

title: Fix: Use port 8080 for nginx (port 80 often in use)
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

demo.sh fails silently when port 80 is in use (common on dev machines).

Fix:
1. Change nginx default port from 80 to 8080 in docker-compose.yml line 204
2. Update .env.example NGINX_HTTP_PORT default to 8080
3. Update demo.sh URL output to show 8080

IMPORTANT: Make sure to push branch before completing: git push -u origin <branch>

title: Infrastructure: Docker Compose & Deployment
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Complete Docker orchestration:

1. docker-compose.yml with all services:
   - postgres:16, redis:7
   - All 4 backend services
   - All 5 frontend apps
   - nginx as API gateway

2. infrastructure/nginx/nginx.conf:
   - Reverse proxy to all services
   - Rate limiting
   - SSL termination (optional for PoC)

3. infrastructure/postgres/init.sql:
   - Database schema
   - Initial roles/permissions

4. deploy.sh single-script deployment:
   - Dependency checks
   - Contract compilation
   - Docker build & start
   - Health checks
   - Summary output

5. .env.example with all required variables

title: Fix: Change postgres:// to postgresql:// for SQLAlchemy 2.x
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Python services crash with 'Can't load plugin: sqlalchemy.dialects:postgres'

SQLAlchemy 2.x removed the 'postgres' alias - must use 'postgresql'.

Fix:
1. Update .env.example DATABASE_URL to use postgresql://
2. Update Python service database.py files to handle both or enforce postgresql://
3. Update docker-compose.yml if it sets DATABASE_URL

title: Fix: Rename 'metadata' column in analytics models (SQLAlchemy reserved)
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

analytics-service crashes: 'Attribute name metadata is reserved when using Declarative API'

SQLAlchemy uses 'metadata' internally. Rename to 'extra_data' or 'meta_info' in models.py
